text:
Hi,
anyone can help , how can we migrate Newsletter to another HubSpot account

Hi Everyone,
I am Facing issue, When I try to call from HubSpot dialer & select my dialer from calling options, it does not look proper, it does not fit in screen.  half screen comes white...Any idea?
hey there! if i’m trying to whitelist HubSpot’s IP addresses for sending API instructions between our network and HS, does anyone have the list of IPs? HubSpot support suggested asking here
nop, you can only move things between design tools, not LP o WP
I want to use both a Tag Name and it's slug in my module. I can't seem to find how to get this in the documentation

Hey <@UFURR5PM3> we are actually looking to expand on the tag field to include an option to return all the data associated with the tag to make this easier to do. Right now, the best path is to use two tag fields and do something like this:
```<a href="{{blog_tag_url('default', module.tag_field|string)}}">{{module.second_tag_field}}</a>```
where the first tag field is outputting the slug and the second outputs the name.

We know its not ideal but be assured this is a high priority on our end. Ill keep you updated on the progress we make on the field update.

Thanks for the quick reply AJ! It would be great if there were a filter like get_tag_by_slug() or get_tag_by_id() then you could just plug your variable in.

Looking forward to it! Thanks again for the reply!
No problem, I’ll pass that back to the team as well and see about getting a function created for it also :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Ben, unfortunately HubSpot doesn’t publish a list of IP addresses. We use a lot of IP addresses and they change pretty frequently.

If you’re trying to verify that a request from HubSpot to your network is legitimate, you can probably use the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/validating-requests-from-HubSpot|request signature>. If you need to allow the IP for an outgoing request from your network to HubSpot, I’m not sure what the best solution would be, other than maybe a proxy to a different service/network that didn’t have such a strict firewall.
